result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachariah H. Reynolds was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber if approved by jail administration. 
Defendant is eligible for 1/2 jail sentence on Electronic Monitoring if approved by the risk assessment and jail administration.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs and surcharges. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Comply with same conditions as listed in 15CM503.

records.addlTxt:
9:49 a.m. Defendant Zachariah H. Reynolds in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Defendant Zachariah H. Reynolds in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases 15CM410, 15CM496, 15CM497, and 15CM503 are heard today.
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CM410 Ct 1: No Contest
15CM410 Ct 2: No Contest
15CM496: No Contest
15CM503 Ct 2: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CM410 Ct 1 & 2; 15CM496; & 15CM503 Ct 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. 15CM497 and 15CM503 ct 1 are Dismissed and Read In.

ADA Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court requesting on the jail sentences that he be allowed huber, but no electronic monitor. 
Atty Halverson concurs in part with the joint recommendation, but requests not to impose jail on 15CM496 or let him have huber w/electronic monitor for treatment. 
Defendant makes statements.

BY THE COURT:******PROBATION****
15CM410 Ct 1: 947.01(1) Disorderly Conduct - Misd: 
I/S Sentence: 24 mo Probation
9 mo jail - stayed (with huber 1/2 half electronic monitor)
39 days credit
Conditions:
Conditions:
Comply with same conditions as listed in 15CM503.

15CM410 Ct 2: 946.41(1) Resist/Obstruct - Misd:
I/S Sentence: 24 mo Probation
9 mo jail - stayed (with huber 1/2 half electronic monitor)
39 days credit
Comply with same conditions as stated in 15CM503.
Pay costs and DNA surcharges.

15CM496: 946.49(1)(a) Bail Jump-Misd:
Straight jail time of 120 days with 68 days credits. (w/huber but no electronic monitor)
Pay costs and DNA surcharge.  Pay within 60 days or setup a payment plan.

15CM503 Ct 2: 946.41(1) Resist/Obstruct - Misd:
I/S Sentence: 9 mo jail, consecutive (with huber 1/2 half electronic monitor)  - stayed.
24 mo Probation:
Conditions:
Pay costs and DNA surcharge.  
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  
Obtain and maintain full-time employment.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Provide DNA sample, if not done so.
No Contact with Athena Nehls, her residence, or her family.
Submit apology letter for victim to Agent first with in 30day and Agent will forward to victim.
Pay costs and DNA surcharge.

Defendant Zachariah H. Reynolds in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Defendant Zachariah H. Reynolds in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:50 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Atty Knaapen makes statements.  Defendant has new charges.  Requests this file be heard on Monday with the other files. 
Court will set for PTC. 

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 09:30 am.

10/26/15:  Bond amended from $750 cash to $750 signature bond. 
Conditions remain the same: 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment. 
if released, then  Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.   
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:    Athena Neils or her residence.
Written Stipulation and Request to  Amend Bond AND COURT ORDER /s/ TBE 10/26/15
